segment.source: Planning Your Streaming Solution in an Electronic Software Distribution Implementation
segment.target: Planning Your Streaming Solution in an Electronic Software Distribution Implementation

segment.source: Planning Your Streaming Solution in an Electronic Software Distribution Implementation
segment.target: Planning Your Streaming Solution in an Electronic Software Distribution Implementation

segment.source: Planning Your Streaming Solution in an Electronic Software Distribution Implementation
segment.target: Planning Your Streaming Solution in an Electronic Software Distribution Implementation

segment.source: If you decide to use streaming servers in conjunction with your ESD system to make application content available to your end user computers, you can choose from several alternatives, taking advantage of whatever infrastructure is already in place.
segment.target: If you decide to use streaming servers in conjunction with your ESD system to make application content available to your end user computers, you can choose from several alternatives, taking advantage of whatever infrastructure is already in place.

segment.source: For example, if your ESD system has software distribution shares on servers in your field branch offices, you can place the Application Virtualization CONTENT share on those servers and then configure the clients to use that content share as their application content source.
segment.target: For example, if your ESD system has software distribution shares on servers in your field branch offices, you can place the Application Virtualization CONTENT share on those servers and then configure the clients to use that content share as their application content source.

segment.source: The supported options include using a file server or an IIS server.
segment.target: The supported options include using a file server or an IIS server.

segment.source: You could also install the Application Virtualization Streaming Server on an existing file server or IIS server.
segment.target: You could also install the Application Virtualization Streaming Server on an existing file server or IIS server.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization Streaming Server provides support for the active upgrade feature in Application Virtualization.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization Streaming Server provides support for the active upgrade feature in Application Virtualization.

segment.source: The active upgrade feature enables a new version of an application to be added to an App-V Management Server or Streaming Server without affecting users currently running the application.
segment.target: The active upgrade feature enables a new version of an application to be added to an App-V Management Server or Streaming Server without affecting users currently running the application.

segment.source: The App-V clients will automatically receive the latest version of the application from the App-V Management Server or Streaming Server the next time the user starts the application.
segment.target: The App-V clients will automatically receive the latest version of the application from the App-V Management Server or Streaming Server the next time the user starts the application.

segment.source: Use of the RTSP(S) protocol is required for this feature.
segment.target: Use of the RTSP(S) protocol is required for this feature.

segment.source: If you choose not to use the Application Virtualization Streaming Server, you will need to explicitly manage application package upgrades by using the ESD system.
segment.target: If you choose not to use the Application Virtualization Streaming Server, you will need to explicitly manage application package upgrades by using the ESD system.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Access to the applications is controlled by means of Security Groups in Active Directory Domain Services, so you will need to plan a process for setting up a security group for each virtual application and for managing which users are added to each group.
segment.target: Access to the applications is controlled by means of Security Groups in Active Directory Domain Services, so you will need to plan a process for setting up a security group for each virtual application and for managing which users are added to each group.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization system administrator configures each streaming server to use these Active Directory groups by applying ACLs to the application directories under the CONTENT share, which controls access to the packages based on Active Directory group membership.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization system administrator configures each streaming server to use these Active Directory groups by applying ACLs to the application directories under the CONTENT share, which controls access to the packages based on Active Directory group membership.

segment.source: The characteristics of the available streaming options are summarized in the following table.
segment.target: The characteristics of the available streaming options are summarized in the following table.
